importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the article was updated, indicating the current context of the TikTok drama involving Sombr and fan Meg.

keyTakeAways: Shane Boose, a 20-year-old singer performing under the stage name Sombr, gained popularity through viral singles like 'Back to Friends' and 'Undressed' on TikTok and social media.

A TikTok user named Meg, aged 25, posted a scathing review of Sombr's concert at The Anthem in Washington, DC, describing it as one of the worst experiences of her life due to an immature and cringe-worthy performance.
The concert was overcrowded with young attendees, leading Meg to describe it as resembling a middle school dance, with only a few adults present.
Sombr made jokes involving niche memes, including a 6-7 joke, and performed a 'dating show' sketch where he solicited young fans to call their 'toxic exes,' which Meg found inappropriate and cringey.

Sombr responded to Meg's post by calling it 'TikTok drama,' arguing that as a 20-year-old artist, it's normal for his audience to include younger people, and that he only makes jokes for a short period during the concert.
In his response video, Sombr used a 'touch grass' social media diss, suggesting a lighthearted and casual attitude toward the criticism.
Meg expressed that despite her political content often sparking division, she received significant backlash specifically after posting her concert review.
The incident highlights the growing influence of social media platforms like TikTok in shaping public discourse around live performances and artist behavior.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Shane Boose, a 20-year-old singer known as Sombr, gained attention through viral singles like 'Back to Friends' and 'Undressed,' building a large fan base on social media. During a concert at The Anthem in Washington, DC, as part of the Late Nights & Young Romance Tour, a 25-year-old TikTok user named Meg criticized the event, calling it one of the worst experiences of her life due to an overcrowded, youth-dominated audience and immature, meme-based jokes, including a '6-7 joke' and a cringey 'dating show' sketch involving fans calling their 'toxic exes.' Sombr responded with a video calling it 'TikTok drama,' arguing that as a young artist, it's normal to have a younger audience and that he only jokes for a short time during the concert. He used a 'touch grass' diss to downplay the criticism. Meg noted she received disproportionate backlash compared to her previous political posts, highlighting the intensity of online reactions to live performance critiques.
